availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jeremiah Herbert (Kenton County, Kentucky, currier and pvt. 4th Ky Mtd Inf + 1st Ky LtArtillery)

body.p: Kenton County, Kentucky, currier and soldier. Ohio native. Son of Patrick Herbert and Matilda Herbert. Married to Catharine Lindsey Herbert in Hamilton County, Ohio, on June 5, 1858. Father of Andrew Herbert, Emma Herbert, and Charles Herbert. Currier in Cincinnati, Ohio, in 1850. Currier in Covington, Kentucky, in 1860. Printer in 1863. Served in the 1st Kentucky Light Artillery Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from December 4, 1863, to May 7, 1864. Served in the 4th Kentucky Mounted Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from May 7, 1864. Reported as deserted from Lexington, Kentucky, on June 1, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati, Ward 10, p. 89B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, Ward 2, p. 581.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Indiana, Morgan County, Martinsville, p. 148C-148D.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 513, 638.
Ohio, U.S., County Marriage Records, 1774-1993, Various Ohio County Courthouses, Ohio, Hamilton County Marriages, 1858-1860, Film #000344473, p. 73 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Rolls 0149, 0481.
